description:
Add the TestNetscapePlugIn to the browser_test dependencies,
as some of the PrerenderBrowserTests used them.

BUG=none
TEST=delete the plugin, build and run browser tests.
Committed: http://src.chromium.org/viewvc/chrome?view=rev&revision=84438

messages.text: Copied the dependency from the UI tests, which also use the plugin.  Tested locally.
LGTM, but do you need permission from one of the Chrome gods?

On 2011/05/05 19:12:35, cbentzel wrote:
> LGTM, but do you need permission from one of the Chrome gods?

If it weren't used in the ui_tests, I'd say yes.  As it is, I can't see any reason for objection.

I have no objection to running it by one of Them, however.  Not really sure which one would have jurisdiction.

Presubmit check for 6927045-1 failed and returned exit status 1.

Running presubmit commit checks ...

** Presubmit Warnings **
Found lines longer than 80 characters (first 5 shown).
  chrome/chrome_tests.gypi, line 2189, 90 chars

On 2011/05/05 19:22:19, Matt Menke wrote:
> On 2011/05/05 19:12:35, cbentzel wrote:
> > LGTM, but do you need permission from one of the Chrome gods?
> 
> If it weren't used in the ui_tests, I'd say yes.  As it is, I can't see any
> reason for objection.
> 
> I have no objection to running it by one of Them, however.  Not really sure
> which one would have jurisdiction.

I've gone ahead and landed the CL.  The only other plugin included with Chromium is the "vnd.npapi-test" test plugin.

That plugin doesn't export any functions.  It runs a hard-coded test identified by an embed tag parameter and then calls back to Javascript.  This doesn't work for us because we end up with a race between the plugin's callback function and our test callback function on load.  There may be another way to check if the plugin has already loaded, but if so, I'm unaware of it.  It could also, of course, be modified to export a function.

I may look into this later, but I don't think it's really an issue, since the ui_tests use it and there's been no effort to change that.

subject: Add the TestNetscapePlugIn to the browser_test dependencies.
